newsitem.title: JAPAN: Japan's Yoshinoya to boost U.S. fast food outlets.
newsitem.headline: Japan's Yoshinoya to boost U.S. fast food outlets.

text.p: Japanese fast food chain operator Yoshinoya D & C Co Ltd said on Monday that it plans to set up fast food franchises in the United States in addition to outlets already operated by its U.S. subsidiary.
It plans to establish 700 franchised outlets and to boost the number of outlets directly managed by its U.S. subsidiary, Yoshinoya West Inc, to 200 from the current 90 by the end of February 2007.
Yoshinoya forecast that the franchise chain and Yoshinoya West's stores will post combined sales of 70 billion yen ($593 million) in the business year through February 2007.

A spokesman denied a report in the Japanese business daily Nihon Keizai Shimbun's evening edition on Monday that the company was considering listing Yoshinoya West's shares on NASDAQ, although he did not rule out the possibility that a listing would be considered in the future.
Yoshinoya's fast food shops serve "gyudon", seasoned beef on rice in a bowl.
